text:
- Baxter Healthcare, we've
been around for 90 years.
Our mission is to save and sustain lives
across a number of critical therapies.
We had 1400 applications
that we wanted to move to the cloud.
Now we're hitting the phase

where we're moving into
cloud modernization
and cloud native activities.

We had legacy data centers
we needed to move out of.
So we focused initially on lift and shifts

to meet that deadline and
meet our cost savings.

We started looking at ways
that we could innovate

on the device side and
on the patient side,

how we could deliver mobile
applications, analytics,
IoT solutions, tied to our therapies.
We're building a number of applications,
at the core they're IoT applications,
but each of 'em has some common components
that we need to connect, collect, analyze,
engage, and then support those devices.
We chose AWS because of its ability

to meet a lot of the certification
needs around the globe.
The cost savings was a first step for us.
Really, it's allowed us now to reinvest

that in R and D, in
innovation around the devices,

in each of our divisions
within medication delivery,

acute, renal, bringing
new solutions to patients.
